trans-unit.source: Processes XAML markup from XML files by using an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> intermediary, and produces a XAML node stream.
When you construct a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>, an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is required.

The purpose of this design is to use established [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] APIs for XML processing in order to handle stream input, to obtain a stream from a file, and so on.

<xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is the first component of the standard load path for XAML operations and is incorporated by <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%2A?displayProperty=fullName> as well as by several existing framework XAML implementations for loading XAML.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a stream.
The initial stream to load into the reader.
stream is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class using the provided <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>, schema context, and reader settings.
Initializing with this constructor attempts to merge some of the settings from the provided `xmlReader` together with the XAML-specific settings in `settings`.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to use as the intermediary XML processor.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
The specific XAML reader settings.
xmlReader or schemaContext is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on the file name of a file to load into a default XML reader, and using a supplied XAML schema context and XAML-specific reader settings.
Initializing with this constructor attempts to merge some of the settings from the default reader together with the XAML-specific settings in `settings`.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings>.
The name of the XML file to load.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
The specific reader settings.
fileName is `null`.
-or-
schemaContext is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a stream, with a supplied XAML schema context and XAML-specific settings.
Initializing with this constructor attempts to merge some of the settings from the default reader together with the XAML-specific settings in `settings`.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings>.
The initial stream to load into the reader.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
The specific reader settings.
stream or schemaContext is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, using the provided <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and reader settings.
Initializing with this constructor attempts to merge some of the settings from the provided `xmlReader` together with the XAML-specific settings in `settings`.
Initializing with this constructor also sets default reader settings.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings>.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to use as the intermediary XML processor.
The specific XAML reader settings.
xmlReader or schemaContext is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class using the provided <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and schema context.
Initializing with this constructor also sets default reader settings.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to use as the intermediary XML processor.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
xmlReader or schemaContext is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on the file name of a file to load into a default XML reader, and using XAML-specific reader settings.
The name of the XML file to load.
The specific reader settings.
fileName is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on the file name of a file to load into a default XML reader, with a supplied XAML schema context.
The name of the file to load.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
fileName or schemaContext is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref>, and using a supplied schema context and XAML-specific settings.
Initializing with this constructor attempts to merge some of the settings from the default reader together with the XAML-specific settings in `settings`.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings>.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> to use for initialization.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
The specific reader settings.
textReader is `null`.
-or-
schemaContext is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref>, with a supplied schema context and XAML-specific settings.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> to use for initialization.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
textReader is `null`.
-or-
schemaContext is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a stream, with XAML-specific settings.
Initializing with this constructor attempts to merge some of the settings from the default reader together with the XAML-specific settings in `settings`.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings>.
The initial stream to load into the reader.
The specific reader settings.
stream is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a stream, and using a supplied XAML schema context.
The initial stream to load into the reader.
The XAML schema context for XAML processing.
stream or schemaContext is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class using the provided <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref>.
Initializing with this constructor also sets a default XAML schema context and default reader settings.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to use as the intermediary XML processor.
xmlReader is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref>, and using XAML-specific settings.
Initializing with this constructor attempts to merge some of the settings from the default reader together with the XAML-specific settings in `settings`.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings>.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> to use for initialization.
The specific reader settings.
textReader is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a file name of a file to load into a default XML reader.
The name of the XML file to load.
fileName is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> class, based on a <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextReader"></xref> to use for initialization.
textReader is `null`.
Gets a value that specifies whether line information is available.
This property is part of the <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo> implementation.
The result is partially based on the reader settings that were used to initialize this <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>.
`true` if line information is available; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that reports whether the reader position in the XAML node stream is at end-of-file.
If you are currently using a subtree reader, the subtree reader reports <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.IsEof%2A> after exiting the bounds of the subtree.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader.ReadSubtree%2A>.
`true` if the position is at the conceptual end-of-file in the node stream; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the line number to report.
This property is part of the <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo> implementation.

Node types of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartObject>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartMember>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.NamespaceDeclaration>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.Value> can return a line number.
Other node types return a value of 0.
All node types return 0 if <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.HasLineInfo%2A> is `false`.
The line number to report.
Gets the line position to report.
This property is part of the <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlLineInfo> implementation.

Node types of <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartObject>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartMember>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.NamespaceDeclaration>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.Value> can return a line position.
Other node types return a value of 0.
All node types return 0 if <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.HasLineInfo%2A> is `false`.
The line position to report.
Gets the current member at the reader position, if the current reader position is on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartMember"></xref>.
The current member; or `null`, if the current reader position is not on a member.
Gets the XAML namespace from the current node.
This property only has a non-null result if the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.NodeType%2A> of the current position is <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.NamespaceDeclaration>.
This property does not report the XAML namespace that applies to objects or members in a general scoping sense.
Your implementation should cache XAML namespace information if you need it for specific operations.
For default operations that involve the loaded XAML schema context, the acting XAML namespace is internally cached by XAML writer implementations.
The XAML namespace from the current node, if it is available; otherwise, `null`.
Gets the type of the current node.
A value of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType"></xref> enumeration.
Provides the next XAML node from the loaded source, if a XAML node is available.
A node where <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.Read%2A> returns `false` also returns `true` for <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.IsEof%2A>.
Calling <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.Read%2A> generally has the side effect of advancing the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.LineNumber%2A> or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.LinePosition%2A>.
The next operation after calling <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.Read%2A> and getting a `true` result is typically to check <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.NodeType%2A>.

For more information about XAML node stream concepts, see [Understanding XAML Node Stream Structures and Concepts](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/understanding-xaml-node-stream-structures-and-concepts.md).
`true` if a node is available; otherwise, `false`.
Gets an object that provides schema information for the information set.
This value is either the default XAML schema context or a specifically derived XAML schema context that is provided as constructor information.
Schema context affects many aspects of XAML processing behavior.
In particular, the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.SchemaContext%2A> of the reader is generally used by any associated writer.
An object that provides schema information for the information set.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the current node.
This property only has a non-null result if the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader.NodeType%2A> of the current position is <xref:System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.StartObject>.
The <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlType"></xref> of the current node; or `null`, if the position is not on an object.
Gets the value of the current node.
The value of the current node; or `null`, if the position is not on a <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlNodeType.Value"></xref> node type.
